titleStmt.title: Taylors feast contayning twenty-seaven dishes of meate, without bread, drinke, meate, fruite, flesh, fish, sawce, sallats, or sweet-meats, only a good stomacke, &c. Being full of variety and witty mirth. By John Taylor.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. Okes dwelling in little St. Bartholmews,

notesStmt.note: Error in pagination: page 7 is incorrectly labeled p. 9.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
